paragraphs.text: %md # DataSci Tutorial 1: Setup for R, SparkR, RStudio Server This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.3.5-20 as part of the Data Science Acceleration User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: Be sure you previously ran the New Data Lake Tutorials: "Citi Bike New York Demo Introduction and Setup" and "Working with Hive". They can be found at https://github.com/oracle/learning-library/tree/master/workshops/journey2-new-data-lake This notebook provides shell scripts to install various R components. There are a couple of key requirements before running this (sudo for the zeppelin user and an increased timeout for the zeppelin shell interpreter). Assuming you used the bootstrap.sh script as instructed in the New Data Lake instructions when you created your BDCS-CE instance, then these requirement have already been met.

msg.data:
DataSci Tutorial 1: Setup for R, SparkR, RStudio Server

This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.3.5-20 as part of the Data Science Acceleration User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: david.bayard@oracle.com

Be sure you previously ran the New Data Lake Tutorials: "Citi Bike New York Demo Introduction and Setup" and "Working with Hive".
They can be found at https://github.com/oracle/learning-library/tree/master/workshops/journey2-new-data-lake

This notebook provides shell scripts to install various R components.

There are a couple of key requirements before running this (sudo for the zeppelin user and an increased timeout for the zeppelin shell interpreter). Assuming you used the bootstrap.sh script as instructed in the New Data Lake instructions when you created your BDCS-CE instance, then these requirement have already been met.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Install Oracle R Distribution for BDCS-CE

The next paragraph will run a script /usr/bin/install-oracle-r.sh that is provided with BDCS-CE.  This script installs:

+ Oracle R Distribution 3.2
+ R Zeppelin support files
+ R Packages: devtools, knitr, ggplot2, RCurl, RJSONIO, devtools, mplot, googleVis, rCharts, plus many other dependencies

Note: the next paragraph will take about 20 minutes to run.  Please be patient.

msg.data:
Install Oracle R Distribution for BDCS-CE

The next paragraph will run a script /usr/bin/install-oracle-r.sh that is provided with BDCS-CE. This script installs:

  • Oracle R Distribution 3.2
  • R Zeppelin support files
  • R Packages: devtools, knitr, ggplot2, RCurl, RJSONIO, devtools, mplot, googleVis, rCharts, plus many other dependencies

Note: the next paragraph will take about 20 minutes to run. Please be patient.

paragraphs.title: Install Oracle R Distribution (will take 20 minutes or so)
paragraphs.text:
%sh
echo "Starting script to install R. Please be patient.  You will not see any more output until it is finished."
# as of BDCSCE 17.3.1, this installs R 3.2
# Note with 17.3.1, we need to set JAVA_HOME to the jdk (not jre) for rJava to install right.
sudo -- sh -c 'export JAVA_HOME=/u01/bdcsce/usr/java/jdk1.8.0_131; export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/u01/bdcsce/usr/java/jdk1.8.0_131/jre/lib/amd64/server; /usr/bin/install-oracle-r.sh > /tmp/install-oracle-r.log 2>&1'
echo ".."
echo ".."
echo "First 50 lines..."
head -50 /tmp/install-oracle-r.log
echo ".."
echo ".."
echo "Last 50 lines..."
tail -50 /tmp/install-oracle-r.log

echo ".."
echo ".."
echo "done"

paragraphs.title: Install RStudio Server (will take about a minute)
Create a user for RStudio Server
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cat <<EOF > /tmp/r_user.sh
	useradd ruser
	echo -e "welcome1\nwelcome1" | passwd ruser
	echo "finsihed adduser" 
	usermod -a -G hive,hadoop ruser
	echo "finsihed groups" 
	sudo -u hdfs hadoop fs -mkdir /user/ruser
	sudo -u hdfs hadoop fs -chown ruser /user/ruser
	echo "finsihed hdoop fs commands" 
EOF

chmod a+x /tmp/r_user.sh
sudo /tmp/r_user.sh

echo "done"

paragraphs.title: Test that R is working (will take a minute for initial startup)
List of R packages now installed
paragraphs.text:
%r
ip <- as.data.frame(installed.packages()[,c(1,3:4)])
rownames(ip) <- NULL
ip <- ip[is.na(ip$Priority),1:2,drop=FALSE]
print(ip, row.names=FALSE)

%md
# Next Steps

Your BDCS-CE environment is now setup with R, SparkR, RStudio Server, and many common R packages.

Proceed to the next Tutorial to see R and SparkR in action with the Zeppelin Notebook.

msg.data:
Next Steps

Proceed to the next Tutorial to see R and SparkR in action with the Zeppelin Notebook.
